quote_first: “Five minutes ago it was three o’clock,” Murphy said. “I can’t be certain, but I theorize that it must now be about
quote_last:
.”
I folded my arms. “I don’t usually do stakeouts.”
title: White Night
author: Jim Butcher

quote_first: On the Sunday before Christmas she awoke at
quote_last: and thought: Thirty-six hours. Four hours later she got up thinking: Thirty-two hours. Late in the day she took Alfred to the street-association Christmas party at Dale and Honey Driblett’s, sat him down safely with Kirby Root, and proceeded to remind all her neighbors that her favorite grandson, who’d been looking forward all year to a Christmas in St. Jude, was arriving tomorrow afternoon.
title: The Corrections
author: Jonathan Franzen
